=== Introduction ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="width:100%; margin-top:20px;" style="width:400px; border:none; padding-right:20px; vertical-align:top;"><nowiki>[[File:MalaysianTeam/ubuntu-my-400px.jpg]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:none; vertical-align:top;">The Ubuntu Malaysia LoCo Team (MalaysianTeam) aims to be the one stop for everything Ubuntu and for Malaysian Ubuntu lovers to gather, to share, meetup or even just to hang out. Embracing the humanity theme of Ubuntu, we welcome all who are interested in Ubuntu, GNU/Linux and Open Source Software in general to join us making Malaysia great for Ubuntu, GNU/Linux and Open Source.<<BR>><<BR>>Started in July 2005, the Malaysian Team has already grown to over 200 members and has been approved as official LoCo team since 2009. With this, we would like to maintain ourselves as official LoCo team, and this wiki is to prepare ourselves for the re-approval process after the team's application expired on Oct 30^th^, 2011.
|}

=== Roadmap for 2011/2012 ===

* '''Registered with ROS'''
** We plan to have the LoCo registered as NGO with the Registrar of Societies (ROS), Malaysia so that our activities can be recognized and therefore pushing the LoCo brand and generally Ubuntu forward in Malaysia.

=== Achievements of 2010/2011 Roadmap ===

* '''Spreading Ubuntu''' (continuous efforts)
** This is our on-going process where we always spread the Ubuntu to various organization as well as individuals. 
** Malaysian Blog about Ubuntu: (<nowiki>[[http://melayubuntu.blogspot.com]]</nowiki>).
** Ubuntu 11.10 Obeiric Ocelot Awareness campaign: <nowiki>[[MalaysianTeam-Activities-2011-UbuntuAwareness11.10]]</nowiki><<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''Provide local supports''' (continuous efforts)
** We found that most Malaysians are actively using Facebook for online communication. Therefore, we took an effort to manage <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/groups/ubuntumy|Ubuntu Malaysia LoCo Team group on Facebook]]</nowiki> which currently have 796 members for easy local support. <<BR>>{{https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-LLuF8aUPLg4/TqY-XY7EUKI/AAAAAAAACcw/DGTQ5CHSsi8/s640/ubuntu-my-facebook.jpg}}

** We still maintain our IRC channel #ubuntu-my on freenode for realtime local support.
** Our LoCo forum, at http://forums.ubuntu.com.my is also available for local support via forum. But lately, people are more on facebook.<<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''More Ubuntu activities''' (continuous efforts)
** Please refer to the '''Experiences / Efforts''' section below. <<BR>> <<BR>>
* '''Involve in Ubuntu Projects''' (continuous efforts)
** We have various teams involved with this:
** '''translations and localization (l10n)''' &nbsp;&mdash;&nbsp; we have done translations via launchpad (https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-ms); this is a continuous process
** '''documentations''' &nbsp;&mdash;&nbsp; Wiki (http://wiki.ubuntu.com.my) &amp; Ubuntu Manual Project (http://ubuntu-manual.org/)

=== Experiences / Efforts ===

* '''1 Malaysia Broadband Carnival 2011 &mdash; 15^th^ - 16^th^ Oct 2011 ''' <<BR>>Malaysian Government via MAMPU (Malaysian Administrative Modernization and Management Planning Unit) and MCMC (Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission) have invited Ubuntu Malaysia LoCo Team to assist in this carnival by introducing Ubuntu to all participants of this event. We proudly guide them for installation and usage on their brand new netbooks provided by MAMPU & MCMC. <<BR>><<BR>><nowiki>[[http://www.slideshare.net/fenris/introduction-to-ubuntu-9882652|{{https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-eL-64A8ANHY/TqfIDJJ0thI/AAAAAAAACeo/jvXSeiZWG6s/s400/ubuntu-intro-slide-taiping.jpg}}]]</nowiki> {{https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-umz4CiOcaSU/TqfIDvZmxrI/AAAAAAAACes/y5piSanccj8/s400/broadband-carnival-taiping3.jpg}} {{https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-8GM4q23thwU/TqfBrSjIUHI/AAAAAAAACeg/IlQ-xZBdaUs/s400/broadband-carnival-taiping2.jpg}} {{https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-u_H3LUCbx1s/Tqe8FUunK_I/AAAAAAAACdg/aPvLtKylKKA/s400/broadband-carnival-taiping.jpg}}

* '''Software Freedom Day Kuala Lumpur 2011 &mdash; 21^st^ Sept 2011 ''' <<BR>>SFDKL2011 was held at UniKL, Kuala Lumpur. Ubuntu Malaysia LoCo team have taken part in this event by doing presentation and community booth for visitors to get in touch with the Ubuntu community. <<BR>><nowiki>[[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KJxmiag8d4A&list=PL81C19BCD31E483A5|{{https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-VS_KunRvI24/Tqefcz0Q7FI/AAAAAAAACdQ/WQ1FYdLTtH0/s800/sfdkl2011-vid.jpg}}]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[http://www.slideshare.net/fenris/ubuntu-your-choice-of-freedom|{{https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-_Pnmgx8_UwA/TqefdIdJ-MI/AAAAAAAACdU/5np5QEdl9Yo/s400/sfdkl2011-presentation-by-fenris.jpg}}]]</nowiki> {{https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-OgWjGRIIngs/TqfBpJ_GR0I/AAAAAAAACdw/g6dCh76uLTo/s400/sfdkl2011-participants2.jpg}} {{https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-q2luTbd7Ge4/TqfBp1bSLjI/AAAAAAAACd4/gcoK9DRDnlg/s400/sfdkl2011-participants.jpg}}

We have our OSS community booths for demo and spreading Ubuntu CDs to visitors. <<BR>><<BR>>{{https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-Kf_TkH_ev6s/TqfBqdxTInI/AAAAAAAACeA/58tZPFpMZPk/s400/ptm-ukm.jpg}} {{https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-PMbpY_qfzT8/TqfBrE4Z4PI/AAAAAAAACeM/kl911sVRvmE/s400/mosc2011.jpg}}
